results.title: Road sense. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films, Michael McCarthy and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The third part deals with bends; children, animals, cyclists and other unpredictable road users.

results.title: Road sense. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films, Michael McCarthy and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The second deals with the importance of signals, road position of vehicles, and the hazards of overtaking.

results.title: Road sense. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films, Michael McCarthy and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The first opens with a leading truck driver attributing good driving to care on the roads, and follows with some shots of typically careless driving ending with a crash. .
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films, Michael McCarthy and Richard F. Tambling

results.title: Road of iron
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Walford Hewitson
results.brief_description: This film documents the achievements of men who forged into the harsh, untamed wilderness of northern Quebec to lay the line of steel which brought to market the rich iron ore of the Ungava region. It is a story of strength and determination since every man, machine and piece of equipment had to be airlifted in or transported by tractor caravan over the 575-kilometer route. Bit by bit we follow their progress through forest, over muskeg and across rivers until at last the first ore train snakes its way to the seaport of Septiles.

results.title: Road observation
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “How to Drive”.
Shows what to look for in driving, the effect of speed on vision and typical signs and hazards.

results.title: Road movie = Janice
results.creator_credit: Laser Film Corporation and Joseph Strick
results.brief_description:
Two thuggish truck drivers making a desperate fast delivery run across the United States, pick up a prostitute as a diversion. When she offers her body in exchange for the ride the woman, beaten and angry from a previous encounter, begins to experience even more of the degradation she was trying to escape. Rejected and scorned, her feelings of self-pity soon evolve into plans of revenge.

Credits: Producer, director, Joseph Strick ; writer, Judith Rascoe ; photography, Don Lenzer ; editing, Sylvia Sarner ; music, Stanley Myers.
Cast: Robert Drivas, Regina Baff, Barry Bostwick, David Bauer, Regina Baff, Joe Pantoliano.

results.title: Road manners
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for clear hand signals, both to keep the roads safe and as part of good driving manners. Of historic value. Filmed in Lane Cove, Sydney and features several shots of Australia’s beloved Holden.

results.title: Road lore
results.brief_description: The rules of the road are simple. If the motorist observes them they will drive well and safely. David Mackay, racing driver, explains “road lore” and how to practice it.

results.title: Road hazard
results.creator_credit: Peter Tremlett, M A P S and Peter D'Andrea
results.brief_description: A young couple driving through the country side wonder who has been playing funny business with the road signs as they are warned to look out for everything from koalas to kangaroos, to ants, to aliens to Elvis. Cast includes Melissa Robinson, Liam McEvoy and Peter D’Andrea.
